newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Drought status steady in Australia's NSW.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Drought status steady in Australia's NSW.

text.p: January's drought-declared status in the Australian state of New South Wales (NSW) was unchanged on December, state Agriculture Minister Richard Amery said.
He said 17 percent of the state's area was drought-declared.
Above average conditions on the tablelands, slopes and northwest plains had resulted in record average yields for winter cereal crops in many areas, he said.
Fodder and paddock feed was in plentiful supply, he said.
These conditions were not state-wide and areas in the northwest, the far southwest and the Monaro region continued to miss out on beneficial rains, he said.
A higher incidence of strong winds had been reported from these areas, despite cooler than normal temperatures, he said.
